definition: (TV or movie) blooper/continuity error/(theater) to flub one's lines/unintended exposure of a body part/to be exposed (of a scheme or trick)/to reveal sth one intended to conceal through a slip of the tongue/to blow one's cover
to wear/to put on/to dress/to bore through/to pierce/to perforate/to penetrate/to pass through/to thread
old variant of 幫|帮[bang1]
to help/to assist/to support/for sb (i.e. as a help)/hired (as worker)/side (of pail, boat etc)/outer layer/upper (of a shoe)/group/gang/clique/party/secret society
old variant of 幫|帮[bang1]

sentences.english: Not very nice , goof lens and more.
sentences.chinese: 不怎么好看，穿帮镜头多。

sentences.english: Scam it away, the right to name two suspects fled with money to Indonesia.
sentences.chinese: 骗局穿帮后，两名权姓嫌疑人携款逃往印度尼西亚。

definition: to leak/to expose (sb's secret)/to spill the beans/to let the cat out of the bag
to reveal the cloven foot (idiom); to unmask one's true nature/to give the game away
erhua variant of 露餡|露馅[lou4 xian4]
(of an actor) to disengage from the performance (e.g. after the show ends)/(of an audience) to lose interest in the performance
to reveal the cloven foot (idiom); to unmask one's true nature/to give the game away
sth one wishes to conceal/the cat (as in "let the cat out of the bag")
pretense that turns into reality (idiom); to play at make-believe, but accidentally make it true
(coll.) to have sth embarrassing happen
to expose/to unmask/to see through (a lie etc)
to make a fool of oneself
to clip (an image)/image clipping
to blurt out/to let slip
laughable low-budget special effects
to make a fool of oneself
(of a man) to dress as a woman (idiom)
